reviews.review:
After playing Quake a lot, I knew I had to look at Half Life.

Truly unforgiving, but in a good way. This isn't some halo 2 legendary type of stupidity that would force you to rely on one strategy, but rather some severe difficulty that would force you to tinker for every encounters. Run, think, shoot and live is the motto and I wish other games had such difficulty curves.

The rest? I do not need to explain.

While some may state that the game has shown its age and is no longer visually appealing and enjoyable, I genuinely felt a sense of euphoria while playing the game.  The pacing of combat, environments, and story come together in tandem with a sense of needing to use your brain at times. It's a groundbreaking game that all FPS fans should play at least once. The story may feel a little scarce, but it's the least of your concern. This game's highlight stems from the environments and the unique aspect of what Valve has created - the entire game perpetually propelling you forward as you enter unique environments and combat scenarios non-stop. It's incredible, and I can't get over how much I love that and other things about the game.

However, I noticed one issue in some combat instances where you are facing enemies at medium to low health with little to no suit charge. At times, completion of several combat scenarios may be impossible; even on easy mode, it was genuinely challenging at times should you be in low health from a previous altercation. While this may be my issue with being "shit" or "bad," I beg to differ. I wouldn't recommend this on hard mode. The worst thing about Half-Life is the chapters set in Xen by far. The level design is a trainwreck, it's visually unappealing, and it contains some sloppy platforming and boring boss fights. The entire game is golden, save for Xen. Usually, when I finished Lambda Core, I'd power through to Interloper and eventually stop playing. However, as I said, the entire game is golden - save for Xen.

All in all, I recommend this game to anyone into First-Person Shooters or even those NOT into First-Person Shooters. It's a must-play and a unique experience that will not leave you disappointed.

9/10

You obviously don't need to hear from me that this game is cult, so I'll stick to this: having played it through for the first time in 2021, I can clearly see why Half-Life has its place in the Hall of Fame of videogames. Extraordinary sci-fi atmosphere for that time, digital voices, intriguing scenario: the game is absolutely unique and I now have a backward perspective on many games that I've played, that clearly take inspiration from it.
Good play clean game

My personal favorite game of all time. It holds up surprisingly well for being from 1998. The story and the combat compliment each other very well, and neither overstays their welcome, while you're in Black Mesa, that is. That being said, this game isn't for everyone. Being old, it has its share of jank, and the final four chapters of the game are universally agreed to be utter garbage. If you're into older shooters, definitely check this one out. If you're used to something more modern, consider looking at the fan-remake of this game: Black Mesa. Stay far away from Half Life Source unless you're looking for Gmod assets.

Hay poco que decir sobre esta joya que no se haya dicho ya. Básicamente es un FPS que [i]reinventó la rueda[/i] en su momento, increíble en lo jugable, con una historia magnífica y personajes carismáticos, y con una tecnología espectacular para la época.

A día de hoy, obviamente está (muy) desfasado gráficamente (para aquellos que no puedan soportarlo, existe Black Mesa (magnífico remake)), pero dejando de lado ese apartado, sigue siendo un shooter muy disfrutable después de tantos años.

En mi opinión, no llega al nivel de casi-perfección de la segunda entrega, pero es un juego sobresaliente (además del inicio de la, probablemente, mejor saga de shooters de la historia).

✪✯✪✯✪✯✪ [h3]9.0 / 10[/h3] ✪✯✪✯✪✯✪
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=428888559
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=842784334
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=293877719

Gameplay: It's similar to Quake 1 (the game uses a modded engine of Quake) and It's fun.

Story: It's pretty basic, but not bad at all.

Optimization: The game is pretty optimized for the mayority of 2000's devices, but if your PC doesn't support ''OpenGL'' then you'll need to play on ''software'' for the best performance.

Lenght: If it's your first playthrough the game can last up to 10-12 hours if you play it non-stop.

Graphics: Good for it's time, but it can make a kid vomit nowadays.

Gunplay: Pretty good, especially on multiplayer.

Multiplayer: It's good and balanced.

Difficulty:   Easy: child's play       Normal: balanced      Hard: somewhat challenging

Bugs: Never found a significant bug nor a game breaking one.

AI: Enemy AI is basic and can be very fun to fight with, but the friendly AI can get very stupid at some points of the game.

Soundtrack: It's awesome, especially if you like rock and old electronic music.

Modding community: There are awesome mods in the modding community.

One of the best old-school games out there.

9.5/10

It's easy to see why this was called "The Best Game Ever" in 1998. I never played it then, but I am going back and playing it now with much satisfaction. The story moves along without cutscenes (weird for modern games but it works well) and the puzzles and weapons keep you interested. Back to the old days of saving before a big jump, running out of ammo, conserving health, and try, try again. Great times.
